actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, S. Rept. 94-561.
Measure reconsidered and repassed in Senate with amendment.
Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.
Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, H. Rept. 94-819.
Measure called up by consent calendar in House.

official_title: An Act to amend section 5202 of title 10, United States Code, relating to the detail, pay, and succession to duties of the Assistant Commandant of the Marine Corps and to amend title 10 of the United States Code in order to make certain disability retirement determinations by the Secretaries of the military departments subject to review by the Secretary of Defense.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Armed Services with amendment, H. Rept. 94-819) Deletes provisions of current Federal law requiring a Marine Corps active duty strength of 200,000 before the Assistant Commandant of the Corps can hold the rank of general. Provides that the determination to retire, separate, or place on temporary disability general officers, Medical Corps officers, or medical officers of the Air Force because of disability, must be approved by the Secretary of Defense on the recommendation of the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Health and Environment.

titles.title: A bill to amend sections 5202 and 5232 of title 10, United States Code, relating to the appointment to the grades of general and lieutenant general of Marine Corps officers designated for appropriate higher commands or for performance of duties of great importance and responsibility.

An Act to amend section 5202 of title 10, United States Code, relating to the detail, pay, and succession to duties of the Assistant Commandant of the Marine Corps and to amend title 10 of the United States Code in order to make certain disability retirement determinations by the Secretaries of the military departments subject to review by the Secretary of Defense.
